source.a340ed64:
import pandas as pd

test=pd.read_csv('../input/tabular-playground-series-may-2021/test.csv')
y1=pd.read_csv("../input/tps-may2021-optuna-lightgbm-tpe/lgbm_optuna_tpe.csv")
y2=pd.read_csv("../input/tps-may2021-optuna-lightgbm-tuner/lgbm_tuner.csv")
#y3=pd.read_csv("../input/tps-may2021-optuna-tuner-one-x-rest/lgbm_tuner_one_x_rest.csv")
y3=pd.read_csv("../input/tps-may2021-r-eda-tidymodels-workflowsets/lgbm_tun.csv")
y4=pd.read_csv("../input/tps-may21-ecommerce-lightautoml/Submission1.csv")
y5=pd.read_csv("../input/lightautoml-baseline-tps-may-2021/lightautoml_2variants_ensemble.csv")
y6=pd.read_csv("../input/mljar-automl-tps-may-21/1_submission.csv")
y7=pd.read_csv("../input/tps-may-eda-catboost-lgbm-xgboost-lightautoml/lightautoml.csv")
y8=pd.read_csv("../input/tps-may-a-complete-analysis/lightautoml_v1_1hour.csv")

sub = pd.DataFrame({
    "id": test.id,
    "Class_1": (y1.Class_1+y2.Class_1+y3.Class_1+y4.Class_1+y5.Class_1+y6.Class_1+y7.Class_1+y8.Class_1) / 8,
    "Class_2": (y1.Class_2+y2.Class_2+y3.Class_2+y4.Class_2+y5.Class_2+y6.Class_2+y7.Class_2+y8.Class_2) / 8,
    "Class_3": (y1.Class_3+y2.Class_3+y3.Class_3+y4.Class_3+y5.Class_3+y6.Class_3+y7.Class_3+y8.Class_3) / 8,
    "Class_4": (y1.Class_4+y2.Class_4+y3.Class_4+y4.Class_4+y5.Class_4+y6.Class_4+y7.Class_4+y8.Class_4) / 8
})
source.a581d259:
# Problem definition From description: "The dataset is used for this competition is synthetic, but based on a real dataset and generated using a CTGAN. The original dataset deals with predicting the category on an eCommerce product given various attributes about the listing. Although the features are anonymized, they have properties relating to real-world features." See other notebooks with strategy followed with R: 1. [Finding the best pre-processing configuration and predictive models based on the original data](https://www.kaggle.com/gomes555/tps-may2021-01-r-eda-tidymodels-workflowsets/) 2. [Create DAE dataset and fit models in DAE data](https://www.kaggle.com/gomes555/tps-may2021-02-r-dae-keras) 4. [Ensamble all](https://www.kaggle.com/gomes555/tps-may2021-03-r-tidymodels-stacks/) Notebooks using Python language: 1. [LightGbm sequencial tuning with Optuna Step-wise by LightGBM Tuner](https://www.kaggle.com/gomes555/tps-may2021-optuna-lightgbm-tunner) 2. [LightGbm tuning with Optuna TPE (Tree-structured Parzen Estimator)](https://www.kaggle.com/gomes555/tps-may2021-optuna-lightgbm-tpe/) 3. [LightGbm tuning one vs rest with Optuna Step-wise by LightGBM Tuner](https://www.kaggle.com/gomes555/tps-may2021-optuna-tuner-one-x-rest/) 4. [LightGbm tuning pseudo label with Optuna Tuner](https://www.kaggle.com/gomes555/tps-may2021-lightgbm-pseudolabel/) 5. **Stacking All** All notebooks will be public and suggestions and criticism are very welcome!

Dont forget the upvote if you liked the notebook!
